SEARCH
Package guiRole1

Class ViewRole1Home

java.lang.Object
guiRole1.ViewRole1Home
public class ViewRole1Home extends Object

Title: GUIReviewerHomePage Class.

Description: The Java/FX-based Role1 Home Page. The page is a stub for some role needed for the application. The widgets on this page are likely the minimum number and kind for other role pages that may be needed.

Copyright: Lynn Robert Carter Â© 2025

Version:
1.00 2025-08-20 Initial version
Author:
Lynn Robert Carter

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewRole1Home

      private ViewRole1Home()

      Method: ViewRole1Home()

      Description: This method initializes all the elements of the graphical user interface. This method determines the location, size, font, color, and change and event handlers for each GUI object.

      This is a singleton and is only performed once. Subsequent uses fill in the changeable fields using the displayRole2Home method.

  • Method Details

    • displayRole1Home

      public static void displayRole1Home(javafx.stage.Stage ps, entityClasses.User user, database.Database db)

      Method: displayRole1Home(Stage ps, User user)

      Description: This method is the single entry point from outside this package to cause the Role1 Home page to be displayed. It first sets up every shared attributes so we don't have to pass parameters. It then checks to see if the page has been setup. If not, it instantiates the class, initializes all the static aspects of the GIUI widgets (e.g., location on the page, font, size, and any methods to be performed). After the instantiation, the code then populates the elements that change based on the user and the system's current state. It then sets the Scene onto the stage, and makes it visible to the user.

      Parameters:
      ps - specifies the JavaFX Stage to be used for this GUI and it's methods
      user - specifies the User for this GUI and it's methods
      db - grabs the database to grab user and forum info

    • createThreadFilterPanel

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox createThreadFilterPanel()

      Method: createThreadFilterPanel()

      Description: Create the format and display the thread filter including the individual buttons for each thread (All Posts, All, General, Questions, MyPosts, Unread).

      Returns:
      panel object of the text,action,input, and layout of the thread filter

    • loadPosts

      protected static void loadPosts()

      Method: loadPosts()

      Description: load the posts of the current user under specific categories , MyPosts are posts created by the user, Unread are the posts not yet seen, All being every post in the forum.

    • createPostItem

      private javafx.scene.layout.HBox createPostItem(entityClasses.Post post)

      Method: createPostItem()

      Description: Builds a custom list for one post to be displayed in the main forum. It takes data from the Post object and arranges it in a particular way. Uses information such as the author, time, and thread.

      Parameters:
      post - the object needed to be displayed
      Returns:
      item which contains the post ready to be put into the list

    • filterByThread

      protected static void filterByThread(String thread)

      Method: filterByThread()

      Description: Changes the forum to filter by a specified thread by grabbing the thread and inserting it back to loadPosts thus changing the view.

    • performSearch

      protected static void performSearch()

      Method: performSearch()

      Description: grab the input from the textbox in the search bar and insert it into loadPosts to see posts under the search keywords

    • clearSearch

      protected static void clearSearch()

      Method: clearSearch()

      Description: delete and empty the search bar and load posts

      private static void setupLabelUI(javafx.scene.control.Label l, String ff, double f, double w, javafx.geometry.Pos p, double x, double y)
      Private local method to initialize the standard fields for a label
      Parameters:
      l - The Label object to be initialized
      ff - The font to be used
      f - The size of the font to be used
      w - The width of the Button
      p - The alignment (e.g. left, centered, or right)
      x - The location from the left edge (x axis)
      y - The location from the top (y axis)
